title: The Earth Dragon should fight from the ground!
body:
I think it'd be cool if the Earth Dragon had it's own unique animations where I fought on foot instead of on the wing. I know it's a magical dragon, and I'm not saying it _wouldn't_ be able to fly, but I think it would be a cool thing if, because it's a beast who's domain is the ground and stones and soil, it fought without taking off! It's 'engagement' knockback could be an earthquake instead of a gust of wind under it's wings.

Maybe the Water Dragon too, but especially the Earth Dragon.

replies.body:
They should just go the extra mile and make them all different. The Earth Drake shouldn't even have wings. It should leap out from the sides. The Water Drake can summon a wave of water. The Fire Drake should have flame particles. The Air Drake should be the same. The Elder Dragon should just be special. (I don't care how.)

I especially like the idea of different spawn animations, such as Earth Drake snaking out of the ground, Water Drake swimming in from the river, etc. but the likelihood that Riot could agree whether or not that's a good idea for the game, let alone get it done on time, is quite low.

That should be a new gamemode. 'Dragonswarm.' Imagine dragons soaring all over, attacking towers and champions. You wage war on the dragons, but there are too many of them and you lose tower after tower. All the while, your enemy is too busy killing dragons to fight you, and so most of your kills are dragon take-downs--then suddenly, Dragon Trainer Tristana reconnects and argues for everyone to stop fighting and make peace with the dragons, but it is too late. Too many have died in the fight, hatred and fear run too deep to be purged by the words of an innocent Yordle; as the Elder Dragon rises from the depths to avenge his kin you sharpen your Black Cleaver and don your Thornmail as you prepare for the final battle.

It would be an epic gamemode.
Wow, that went somewhere I was not expecting. I like it.
But that would require them to do actual work.

I think this might be something to tackle for the future! It is possible that they did not have the resources to create completely new effects and change the model skeletons, but it sounds cool enough to work on while people are getting use to the change now
